intro: Pterotheca griselica, commonly known as the narrowleaf pterotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Pterotheca griselica is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
